summary.long: Exodus is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now these are the names of the children of Israel who came to Egypt; each man and his household came with Jacob:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who were descendants of Jacob were seventy persons (for Joseph was in Egypt already).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joseph died, all his brothers, and all that generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children of Israel were fruitful and increased abundantly, multiplied and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who did not know Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to his people, “Look, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: come, let us deal shrewdly with them, lest they multiply, and it happen, in the event of war, that they also join our enemies and fight against us, and so go up out of the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh supply cities, Pithom and Raamses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were in dread of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Egyptians made the children of Israel serve with rigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage—in mortar, in brick, and in all manner of service in the field. All their service in which they made them serve was with rigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of one was Shiphrah and the name of the other Puah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “When you do the duties of a midwife for the Hebrew women, and see them on the birthstools, if it is a son, then you shall kill him; but if it is a daughter, then she shall live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the midwives feared God, and did not do as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the male children alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king of Egypt called for the midwives and said to them, “Why have you done this thing, and saved the male children alive?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women are not like the Egyptian women; for they are lively and give birth before the midwives come to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied and grew very mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, because the midwives feared God, that He provided households for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh commanded all his people, saying, “Every son who is born you shall cast into the river, and every daughter you shall save alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man of the house of Levi went and took as wife a daughter of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the woman conceived and bore a son. And when she saw that he was a beautiful child, she hid him three months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when she could no longer hide him, she took an ark of bulrushes for him, daubed it with asphalt and pitch, put the child in it, and laid it in the reeds by the river’s bank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe at the river. And her maidens walked along the riverside; and when she saw the ark among the reeds, she sent her maid to get it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she opened it, she saw the child, and behold, the baby wept. So she had compassion on him, and said, “This is one of the Hebrews’ children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and call a nurse for you from the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Go.” So the maiden went and called the child’s mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child away and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh’s daughter, and he became her son. So she called his name Moses, saying, “Because I drew him out of the water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown, that he went out to his brethren and looked at their burdens. And he saw an Egyptian beating a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he looked this way and that way, and when he saw no one, he killed the Egyptian and hid him in the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he went out the second day, behold, two Hebrew men were fighting, and he said to the one who did the wrong, “Why are you striking your companion?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he said, “Who made you a prince and a judge over us? Do you intend to kill me as you killed the Egyptian?”
So Moses feared and said, “Surely this thing is known!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pharaoh heard of this matter, he sought to kill Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh and dwelt in the land of Midian; and he sat down by a well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters. And they came and drew water, and they filled the troughs to water their father’s flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Reuel their father, he said, “How is it that you have come so soon today?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “An Egyptian delivered us from the hand of the shepherds, and he also drew enough water for us and watered the flock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to his daughters, “And where is he? Why is it that you have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses was content to live with the man, and he gave Zipporah his daughter to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she bore him a son. He called his name Gershom, for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened in the process of time that the king of Egypt died. Then the children of Israel groaned because of the bondage, and they cried out; and their cry came up to God because of the bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So God heard their groaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God acknowledged them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses was tending the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian. And he led the flock to the back of the desert, and came to Horeb, the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire from the midst of a bush. So he looked, and behold, the bush was burning with fire, but the bush was not consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “I will now turn aside and see this great sight, why the bush does not burn.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So when the Lord saw that he turned aside to look, God called to him from the midst of the bush and said, “Moses, Moses!”
And he said, “Here I am.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then He said, “Do not draw near this place. Take your sandals off your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Moreover He said, “I am the God of your father—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.” And Moses hid his face, for he was afraid to look upon God.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And the Lord said: “I have surely seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt, and have heard their cry because of their taskmasters, for I know their sorrows.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So I have come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up from that land to a good and large land, to a land flowing with milk and honey, to the place of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel has come to Me, and I have also seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Come now, therefore, and I will send you to Pharaoh that you may bring My people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: But Moses said to God, “Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh, and that I should bring the children of Israel out of Egypt?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So He said, “I will certainly be with you. And this shall be a sign to you that I have sent you: When you have brought the people out of Egypt, you shall serve God on this mountain.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then Moses said to God, “Indeed, when I come to the children of Israel and say to them, ‘The God of your fathers has sent me to you,’ and they say to me, ‘What is His name?’ what shall I say to them?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And God said to Moses, “I AM WHO I AM.” And He said, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel, ‘I AM has sent me to you.’ ”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Moreover God said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: ‘The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has sent me to you. This is My name forever, and this is My memorial to all generations.’
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Go and gather the elders of Israel together, and say to them, ‘The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared to me, saying, “I have surely visited you and seen what is done to you in Egypt;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and I have said I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.” ’
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then they will heed your voice; and you shall come, you and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt; and you shall say to him, ‘The Lord God of the Hebrews has met with us; and now, please, let us go three days’ journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God.’
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: But I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not even by a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So I will stretch out My hand and strike Egypt with all My wonders which I will do in its midst; and after that he will let you go.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians; and it shall be, when you go, that you shall not go empty-handed.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: But every woman shall ask of her neighbor, namely, of her who dwells near her house, articles of silver, articles of gold, and clothing; and you shall put them on your sons and on your daughters. So you shall plunder the Egyptians.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then Moses answered and said, “But suppose they will not believe me or listen to my voice; suppose they say, ‘The Lord has not appeared to you.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the Lord said to him, “What is that in your hand?”
He said, “A rod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Cast it on the ground.” So he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moses fled from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Reach out your hand and take it by the tail” (and he reached out his hand and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “that they may believe that the Lord God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, has appeared to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore the Lord said to him, “Now put your hand in your bosom.” And he put his hand in his bosom, and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous, like snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Put your hand in your bosom again.” So he put his hand in his bosom again, and drew it out of his bosom, and behold, it was restored like his other flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then it will be, if they do not believe you, nor heed the message of the first sign, that they may believe the message of the latter sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, if they do not believe even these two signs, or listen to your voice, that you shall take water from the river and pour it on the dry land. The water which you take from the river will become blood on the dry land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to the Lord, “O my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither before nor since You have spoken to Your servant; but I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to him, “Who has made man’s mouth? Or who makes the mute, the deaf, the seeing, or the blind? Have not I, the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, go, and I will be with your mouth and teach you what you shall say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “O my Lord, please send by the hand of whomever else You may send.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the anger of the Lord was kindled against Moses, and He said: “Is not Aaron the Levite your brother? I know that he can speak well. And look, he is also coming out to meet you. When he sees you, he will be glad in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you shall speak to him and put the words in his mouth. And I will be with your mouth and with his mouth, and I will teach you what you shall do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he shall be your spokesman to the people. And he himself shall be as a mouth for you, and you shall be to him as God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take this rod in your hand, with which you shall do the signs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law, and said to him, “Please let me go and return to my brethren who are in Egypt, and see whether they are still alive.”
And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Moses in Midian, “Go, return to Egypt; for all the men who sought your life are dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses took his wife and his sons and set them on a donkey, and he returned to the land of Egypt. And Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “When you go back to Egypt, see that you do all those wonders before Pharaoh which I have put in your hand. But I will harden his heart, so that he will not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall say to Pharaoh, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Israel is My son, My firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I say to you, let My son go that he may serve Me. But if you refuse to let him go, indeed I will kill your son, your firstborn.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass on the way, at the encampment, that the Lord met him and sought to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone and cut off the foreskin of her son and cast it at Moses’ feet, and said, “Surely you are a husband of blood to me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He let him go. Then she said, “You are a husband of blood!”—because of the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Aaron, “Go into the wilderness to meet Moses.” So he went and met him on the mountain of God, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses told Aaron all the words of the Lord who had sent him, and all the signs which He had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron spoke all the words which the Lord had spoken to Moses. Then he did the signs in the sight of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people believed; and when they heard that the Lord had visited the children of Israel and that He had looked on their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Moses and Aaron went in and told Pharaoh, “Thus says the Lord God of Israel: ‘Let My people go, that they may hold a feast to Me in the wilderness.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said, “Who is the Lord, that I should obey His voice to let Israel go? I do not know the Lord, nor will I let Israel go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Please, let us go three days’ journey into the desert and sacrifice to the Lord our God, lest He fall upon us with pestilence or with the sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Egypt said to them, “Moses and Aaron, why do you take the people from their work? Get back to your labor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh said, “Look, the people of the land are many now, and you make them rest from their labor!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people and their officers, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall no longer give the people straw to make brick as before. Let them go and gather straw for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall lay on them the quota of bricks which they made before. You shall not reduce it. For they are idle; therefore they cry out, saying, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let more work be laid on the men, that they may labor in it, and let them not regard false words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the taskmasters of the people and their officers went out and spoke to the people, saying, “Thus says Pharaoh: ‘I will not give you straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, get yourselves straw where you can find it; yet none of your work will be reduced.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the taskmasters forced them to hurry, saying, “Fulfill your work, your daily quota, as when there was straw.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the officers of the children of Israel, whom Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten and were asked, “Why have you not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and today, as before?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried out to Pharaoh, saying, “Why are you dealing thus with your servants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no straw given to your servants, and they say to us, ‘Make brick!’ And indeed your servants are beaten, but the fault is in your own people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said, “You are idle! Idle! Therefore you say, ‘Let us go and sacrifice to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore go now and work; for no straw shall be given you, yet you shall deliver the quota of bricks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the officers of the children of Israel saw that they were in trouble after it was said, “You shall not reduce any bricks from your daily quota.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, as they came out from Pharaoh, they met Moses and Aaron who stood there to meet them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said to them, “Let the Lord look on you and judge, because you have made us abhorrent in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to kill us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Lord, why have You brought trouble on this people? Why is it You have sent me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has done evil to this people; neither have You delivered Your people at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh. For with a strong hand he will let them go, and with a strong hand he will drive them out of his land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke to Moses and said to him: “I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty, but by My name Lord I was not known to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, in which they were strangers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to the children of Israel: ‘I am the Lord; I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, I will rescue you from their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with great judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will take you as My people, and I will be your God. Then you shall know that I am the Lord your God who brings you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring you into the land which I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and I will give it to you as a heritage: I am the Lord.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke thus to the children of Israel; but they did not heed Moses, because of anguish of spirit and cruel bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go in, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the children of Israel go out of his land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spoke before the Lord, saying, “The children of Israel have not heeded me. How then shall Pharaoh heed me, for I am of uncircumcised lips?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, and gave them a command for the children of Israel and for Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the heads of their fathers’ houses: The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi. These are the families of Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Simeon were Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanite woman. These are the families of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. And the years of the life of Levi were one hundred and thirty-seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershon were Libni and Shimi according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel. And the years of the life of Kohath were one hundred and thirty-three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of Levi according to their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Amram took for himself Jochebed, his father’s sister, as wife; and she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were one hundred and thirty-seven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Izhar were Korah, Nepheg, and Zichri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Uzziel were Mishael, Elzaphan, and Zithri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron took to himself Elisheba, daughter of Amminadab, sister of Nahshon, as wife; and she bore him Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Korah were Assir, Elkanah, and Abiasaph. These are the families of the Korahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar, Aaron’s son, took for himself one of the daughters of Putiel as wife; and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the same Aaron and Moses to whom the Lord said, “Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are the same Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on the day the Lord spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “I am the Lord. Speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I say to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said before the Lord, “Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh heed me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses: “See, I have made you as God to Pharaoh, and Aaron your brother shall be your prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak all that I command you. And Aaron your brother shall tell Pharaoh to send the children of Israel out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply My signs and My wonders in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Pharaoh will not heed you, so that I may lay My hand on Egypt and bring My armies and My people, the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt by great judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord, when I stretch out My hand on Egypt and bring out the children of Israel from among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron did so; just as the Lord commanded them, so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was eighty years old and Aaron eighty-three years old when they spoke to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Pharaoh speaks to you, saying, ‘Show a miracle for yourselves,’ then you shall say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod and cast it before Pharaoh, and let it become a serpent.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh, and they did so, just as the Lord commanded. And Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers; so the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their enchantments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every man threw down his rod, and they became serpents. But Aaron’s rod swallowed up their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh’s heart grew hard, and he did not heed them, as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses: “Pharaoh’s heart is hard; he refuses to let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to Pharaoh in the morning, when he goes out to the water, and you shall stand by the river’s bank to meet him; and the rod which was turned to a serpent you shall take in your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to him, ‘The Lord God of the Hebrews has sent me to you, saying, “Let My people go, that they may serve Me in the wilderness”; but indeed, until now you would not hear!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “By this you shall know that I am the Lord. Behold, I will strike the waters which are in the river with the rod that is in my hand, and they shall be turned to blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the fish that are in the river shall die, the river shall stink, and the Egyptians will loathe to drink the water of the river.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Take your rod and stretch out your hand over the waters of Egypt, over their streams, over their rivers, over their ponds, and over all their pools of water, that they may become blood. And there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in buckets of wood and pitchers of stone.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron did so, just as the Lord commanded. So he lifted up the rod and struck the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his servants. And all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fish that were in the river died, the river stank, and the Egyptians could not drink the water of the river. So there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the magicians of Egypt did so with their enchantments; and Pharaoh’s heart grew hard, and he did not heed them, as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh turned and went into his house. Neither was his heart moved by this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the Egyptians dug all around the river for water to drink, because they could not drink the water of the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And seven days passed after the Lord had struck the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all your territory with frogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into your house, into your bedroom, on your bed, into the houses of your servants, on your people, into your ovens, and into your kneading bowls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the frogs shall come up on you, on your people, and on all your servants.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your hand with your rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the magicians did so with their enchantments, and brought up frogs on the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Entreat the Lord that He may take away the frogs from me and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Pharaoh, “Accept the honor of saying when I shall intercede for you, for your servants, and for your people, to destroy the frogs from you and your houses, that they may remain in the river only.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Tomorrow.” And he said, “Let it be according to your word, that you may know that there is no one like the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the frogs shall depart from you, from your houses, from your servants, and from your people. They shall remain in the river only.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh. And Moses cried out to the Lord concerning the frogs which He had brought against Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord did according to the word of Moses. And the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courtyards, and out of the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gathered them together in heaps, and the land stank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Pharaoh saw that there was relief, he hardened his heart and did not heed them, as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your rod, and strike the dust of the land, so that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they did so. For Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod and struck the dust of the earth, and it became lice on man and beast. All the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the magicians so worked with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not. So there were lice on man and beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, “This is the finger of God.” But Pharaoh’s heart grew hard, and he did not heed them, just as the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Rise early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh as he comes out to the water. Then say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else, if you will not let My people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies on you and your servants, on your people and into your houses. The houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground on which they stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in that day I will set apart the land of Goshen, in which My people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there, in order that you may know that I am the Lord in the midst of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make a difference between My people and your people. Tomorrow this sign shall be.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord did so. Thick swarms of flies came into the house of Pharaoh, into his servants’ houses, and into all the land of Egypt. The land was corrupted because of the swarms of flies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, “Go, sacrifice to your God in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “It is not right to do so, for we would be sacrificing the abomination of the Egyptians to the Lord our God. If we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, then will they not stone us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will go three days’ journey into the wilderness and sacrifice to the Lord our God as He will command us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh said, “I will let you go, that you may sacrifice to the Lord your God in the wilderness; only you shall not go very far away. Intercede for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “Indeed I am going out from you, and I will entreat the Lord, that the swarms of flies may depart tomorrow from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. But let Pharaoh not deal deceitfully anymore in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out from Pharaoh and entreated the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord did according to the word of Moses; He removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people. Not one remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also; neither would he let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh and tell him, ‘Thus says the Lord God of the Hebrews: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you refuse to let them go, and still hold them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, the hand of the Lord will be on your cattle in the field, on the horses, on the donkeys, on the camels, on the oxen, and on the sheep—a very severe pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord will make a difference between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt. So nothing shall die of all that belongs to the children of Israel.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord appointed a set time, saying, “Tomorrow the Lord will do this thing in the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord did this thing on the next day, and all the livestock of Egypt died; but of the livestock of the children of Israel, not one died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh sent, and indeed, not even one of the livestock of the Israelites was dead. But the heart of Pharaoh became hard, and he did not let the people go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “Take for yourselves handfuls of ashes from a furnace, and let Moses scatter it toward the heavens in the sight of Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will become fine dust in all the land of Egypt, and it will cause boils that break out in sores on man and beast throughout all the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took ashes from the furnace and stood before Pharaoh, and Moses scattered them toward heaven. And they caused boils that break out in sores on man and beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils, for the boils were on the magicians and on all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh; and he did not heed them, just as the Lord had spoken to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Rise early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord God of the Hebrews: “Let My people go, that they may serve Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for at this time I will send all My plagues to your very heart, and on your servants and on your people, that you may know that there is none like Me in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if I had stretched out My hand and struck you and your people with pestilence, then you would have been cut off from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But indeed for this purpose I have raised you up, that I may show My power in you, and that My name may be declared in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As yet you exalt yourself against My people in that you will not let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause very heavy hail to rain down, such as has not been in Egypt since its founding until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore send now and gather your livestock and all that you have in the field, for the hail shall come down on every man and every animal which is found in the field and is not brought home; and they shall die.” ’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who feared the word of the Lord among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his livestock flee to the houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who did not regard the word of the Lord left his servants and his livestock in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt—on man, on beast, and on every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched out his rod toward heaven; and the Lord sent thunder and hail, and fire darted to the ground. And the Lord rained hail on the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, so very heavy that there was none like it in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hail struck throughout the whole land of Egypt, all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail struck every herb of the field and broke every tree of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, there was no hail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, “I have sinned this time. The Lord is righteous, and my people and I are wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Entreat the Lord, that there may be no more mighty thundering and hail, for it is enough. I will let you go, and you shall stay no longer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to him, “As soon as I have gone out of the city, I will spread out my hands to the Lord; the thunder will cease, and there will be no more hail, that you may know that the earth is the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you and your servants, I know that you will not yet fear the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the flax and the barley were struck, for the barley was in the head and the flax was in bud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the wheat and the spelt were not struck, for they are late crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh and spread out his hands to the Lord; then the thunder and the hail ceased, and the rain was not poured on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain, the hail, and the thunder had ceased, he sinned yet more; and he hardened his heart, he and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the heart of Pharaoh was hard; neither would he let the children of Israel go, as the Lord had spoken by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh; for I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his servants, that I may show these signs of Mine before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you may tell in the hearing of your son and your son’s son the mighty things I have done in Egypt, and My signs which I have done among them, that you may know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron came in to Pharaoh and said to him, “Thus says the Lord God of the Hebrews: ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or else, if you refuse to let My people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall cover the face of the earth, so that no one will be able to see the earth; and they shall eat the residue of what is left, which remains to you from the hail, and they shall eat every tree which grows up for you out of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall fill your houses, the houses of all your servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians—which neither your fathers nor your fathers’ fathers have seen, since the day that they were on the earth to this day.’ ” And he turned and went out from Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh’s servants said to him, “How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, that they may serve the Lord their God. Do you not yet know that Egypt is destroyed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron were brought again to Pharaoh, and he said to them, “Go, serve the Lord your God. Who are the ones that are going?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “We will go with our young and our old; with our sons and our daughters, with our flocks and our herds we will go, for we must hold a feast to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “The Lord had better be with you when I let you and your little ones go! Beware, for evil is ahead of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not so! Go now, you who are men, and serve the Lord, for that is what you desired.” And they were driven out from Pharaoh’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land—all that the hail has left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses stretched out his rod over the land of Egypt, and the Lord brought an east wind on the land all that day and all that night. When it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt and rested on all the territory of Egypt. They were very severe; previously there had been no such locusts as they, nor shall there be such after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they ate every herb of the land and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left. So there remained nothing green on the trees or on the plants of the field throughout all the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste, and said, “I have sinned against the Lord your God and against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, please forgive my sin only this once, and entreat the Lord your God, that He may take away from me this death only.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went out from Pharaoh and entreated the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord turned a very strong west wind, which took the locusts away and blew them into the Red Sea. There remained not one locust in all the territory of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, darkness which may even be felt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven, and there was thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not see one another; nor did anyone rise from his place for three days. But all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh called to Moses and said, “Go, serve the Lord; only let your flocks and your herds be kept back. Let your little ones also go with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said, “You must also give us sacrifices and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our livestock also shall go with us; not a hoof shall be left behind. For we must take some of them to serve the Lord our God, and even we do not know with what we must serve the Lord until we arrive there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh said to him, “Get away from me! Take heed to yourself and see my face no more! For in the day you see my face you shall die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said, “You have spoken well. I will never see your face again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “I will bring one more plague on Pharaoh and on Egypt. Afterward he will let you go from here. When he lets you go, he will surely drive you out of here altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak now in the hearing of the people, and let every man ask from his neighbor and every woman from her neighbor, articles of silver and articles of gold.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants and in the sight of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “Thus says the Lord: ‘About midnight I will go out into the midst of Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, even to the firstborn of the female servant who is behind the handmill, and all the firstborn of the animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as was not like it before, nor shall be like it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But against none of the children of Israel shall a dog move its tongue, against man or beast, that you may know that the Lord does make a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all these your servants shall come down to me and bow down to me, saying, ‘Get out, and all the people who follow you!’ After that I will go out.” Then he went out from Pharaoh in great anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not heed you, so that My wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh; and the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This month shall be your beginning of months; it shall be the first month of the year to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to all the congregation of Israel, saying: ‘On the tenth of this month every man shall take for himself a lamb, according to the house of his father, a lamb for a household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the household is too small for the lamb, let him and his neighbor next to his house take it according to the number of the persons; according to each man’s need you shall make your count for the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year. You may take it from the sheep or from the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month. Then the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at twilight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall take some of the blood and put it on the two doorposts and on the lintel of the houses where they eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shall eat the flesh on that night; roasted in fire, with unleavened bread and with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not eat it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roasted in fire—its head with its legs and its entrails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall let none of it remain until morning, and what remains of it until morning you shall burn with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus you shall eat it: with a belt on your waist, your sandals on your feet, and your staff in your hand. So you shall eat it in haste. It is the Lord’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night, and will strike all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the blood shall be a sign for you on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you; and the plague shall not be on you to destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘So this day shall be to you a memorial; and you shall keep it as a feast to the Lord throughout your generations. You shall keep it as a feast by an everlasting ordinance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the first day you shall remove leaven from your houses. For whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation, and on the seventh day there shall be a holy convocation for you. No manner of work shall be done on them; but that which everyone must eat—that only may be prepared by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread, for on this same day I will have brought your armies out of the land of Egypt. Therefore you shall observe this day throughout your generations as an everlasting ordinance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, you shall eat unleavened bread, until the twenty-first day of the month at evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days no leaven shall be found in your houses, since whoever eats what is leavened, that same person shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he is a stranger or a native of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat nothing leavened; in all your dwellings you shall eat unleavened bread.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel and said to them, “Pick out and take lambs for yourselves according to your families, and kill the Passover lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take a bunch of hyssop, dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two doorposts with the blood that is in the basin. And none of you shall go out of the door of his house until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord will pass through to strike the Egyptians; and when He sees the blood on the lintel and on the two doorposts, the Lord will pass over the door and not allow the destroyer to come into your houses to strike you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall observe this thing as an ordinance for you and your sons forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will come to pass when you come to the land which the Lord will give you, just as He promised, that you shall keep this service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, when your children say to you, ‘What do you mean by this service?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you shall say, ‘It is the Passover sacrifice of the Lord, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt when He struck the Egyptians and delivered our households.’ ” So the people bowed their heads and worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel went away and did so; just as the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass at midnight that the Lord struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sat on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the dungeon, and all the firstborn of livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh rose in the night, he, all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, “Rise, go out from among my people, both you and the children of Israel. And go, serve the Lord as you have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also take your flocks and your herds, as you have said, and be gone; and bless me also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians urged the people, that they might send them out of the land in haste. For they said, “We shall all be dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, having their kneading bowls bound up in their clothes on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the children of Israel had done according to the word of Moses, and they had asked from the Egyptians articles of silver, articles of gold, and clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord had given the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they granted them what they requested. Thus they plundered the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, besides children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A mixed multitude went up with them also, and flocks and herds—a great deal of livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they had brought out of Egypt; for it was not leavened, because they were driven out of Egypt and could not wait, nor had they prepared provisions for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sojourn of the children of Israel who lived in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass at the end of the four hundred and thirty years—on that very same day—it came to pass that all the armies of the Lord went out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a night of solemn observance to the Lord for bringing them out of the land of Egypt. This is that night of the Lord, a solemn observance for all the children of Israel throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, “This is the ordinance of the Passover: No foreigner shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every man’s servant who is bought for money, when you have circumcised him, then he may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In one house it shall be eaten; you shall not carry any of the flesh outside the house, nor shall you break one of its bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a stranger dwells with you and wants to keep the Passover to the Lord, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as a native of the land. For no uncircumcised person shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One law shall be for the native-born and for the stranger who dwells among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus all the children of Israel did; as the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, on that very same day, that the Lord brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt according to their armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Consecrate to Me all the firstborn, whatever opens the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and beast; it is Mine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to the people: “Remember this day in which you went out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the Lord brought you out of this place. No leavened bread shall be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On this day you are going out, in the month Abib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be, when the Lord brings you into the land of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, which He swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, that you shall keep this service in this month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a feast to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days. And no leavened bread shall be seen among you, nor shall leaven be seen among you in all your quarters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall tell your son in that day, saying, ‘This is done because of what the Lord did for me when I came up from Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be as a sign to you on your hand and as a memorial between your eyes, that the Lord’s law may be in your mouth; for with a strong hand the Lord has brought you out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it shall be, when the Lord brings you into the land of the Canaanites, as He swore to you and your fathers, and gives it to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you shall set apart to the Lord all that open the womb, that is, every firstborn that comes from an animal which you have; the males shall be the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb; and if you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. And all the firstborn of man among your sons you shall redeem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it shall be, when your son asks you in time to come, saying, ‘What is this?’ that you shall say to him, ‘By strength of hand the Lord brought us out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh was stubborn about letting us go, that the Lord killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the firstborn of man and the firstborn of beast. Therefore I sacrifice to the Lord all males that open the womb, but all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be as a sign on your hand and as frontlets between your eyes, for by strength of hand the Lord brought us out of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, “Lest perhaps the people change their minds when they see war, and return to Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So God led the people around by way of the wilderness of the Red Sea. And the children of Israel went up in orderly ranks out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for he had placed the children of Israel under solemn oath, saying, “God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones from here with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took their journey from Succoth and camped in Etham at the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of cloud to lead the way, and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light, so as to go by day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not take away the pillar of cloud by day or the pillar of fire by night from before the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, that they turn and camp before Pi Hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, opposite Baal Zephon; you shall camp before it by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, ‘They are bewildered by the land; the wilderness has closed them in.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, so that he will pursue them; and I will gain honor over Pharaoh and over all his army, that the Egyptians may know that I am the Lord.” And they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was told the king of Egypt that the people had fled, and the heart of Pharaoh and his servants was turned against the people; and they said, “Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made ready his chariot and took his people with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, he took six hundred choice chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt with captains over every one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued the children of Israel; and the children of Israel went out with boldness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Egyptians pursued them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, his horsemen and his army, and overtook them camping by the sea beside Pi Hahiroth, before Baal Zephon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Pharaoh drew near, the children of Israel lifted their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians marched after them. So they were very afraid, and the children of Israel cried out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Moses, “Because there were no graves in Egypt, have you taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why have you so dealt with us, to bring us up out of Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is this not the word that we told you in Egypt, saying, ‘Let us alone that we may serve the Egyptians’? For it would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than that we should die in the wilderness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid. Stand still, and see the salvation of the Lord, which He will accomplish for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall see again no more forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will fight for you, and you shall hold your peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Why do you cry to Me? Tell the children of Israel to go forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But lift up your rod, and stretch out your hand over the sea and divide it. And the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I indeed will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall follow them. So I will gain honor over Pharaoh and over all his army, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord, when I have gained honor for Myself over Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, moved and went behind them; and the pillar of cloud went from before them and stood behind them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel. Thus it was a cloud and darkness to the one, and it gave light by night to the other, so that the one did not come near the other all that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the Lord caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea into dry land, and the waters were divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea on the dry ground, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Egyptians pursued and went after them into the midst of the sea, all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, in the morning watch, that the Lord looked down upon the army of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and cloud, and He troubled the army of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He took off their chariot wheels, so that they drove them with difficulty; and the Egyptians said, “Let us flee from the face of Israel, for the Lord fights for them against the Egyptians.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea, that the waters may come back upon the Egyptians, on their chariots, and on their horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and when the morning appeared, the sea returned to its full depth, while the Egyptians were fleeing into it. So the Lord overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the waters returned and covered the chariots, the horsemen, and all the army of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them. Not so much as one of them remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children of Israel had walked on dry land in the midst of the sea, and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand and on their left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel saw the great work which the Lord had done in Egypt; so the people feared the Lord, and believed the Lord and His servant Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Moses and the children of Israel sang this song to the Lord, and spoke, saying:
“I will sing to the Lord,
For He has triumphed gloriously!
The horse and its rider
He has thrown into the sea!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is a man of war;
The Lord is His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pharaoh’s chariots and his army He has cast into the sea;
His chosen captains also are drowned in the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The depths have covered them;
They sank to the bottom like a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your right hand, O Lord, has become glorious in power;
Your right hand, O Lord, has dashed the enemy in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy said, ‘I will pursue,
I will overtake,
I will divide the spoil;
My desire shall be satisfied on them.
I will draw my sword,
My hand shall destroy them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Who is like You, O Lord, among the gods?
Who is like You, glorious in holiness,
Fearful in praises, doing wonders?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You stretched out Your right hand;
The earth swallowed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You in Your mercy have led forth
The people whom You have redeemed;
You have guided them in Your strength
To Your holy habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The people will hear and be afraid;
Sorrow will take hold of the inhabitants of Philistia.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and dread will fall on them;
By the greatness of Your arm
They will be as still as a stone,
Till Your people pass over, O Lord,
Till the people pass over
Whom You have purchased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will bring them in and plant them
In the mountain of Your inheritance,
In the place, O Lord, which You have made
For Your own dwelling,
The sanctuary, O Lord, which Your hands have established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord shall reign forever and ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the horses of Pharaoh went with his chariots and his horsemen into the sea, and the Lord brought back the waters of the sea upon them. But the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took the timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Miriam answered them:
“Sing to the Lord,
For He has triumphed gloriously!
The horse and its rider
He has thrown into the sea!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses brought Israel from the Red Sea; then they went out into the Wilderness of Shur. And they went three days in the wilderness and found no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they came to Marah, they could not drink the waters of Marah, for they were bitter. Therefore the name of it was called Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people complained against Moses, saying, “What shall we drink?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he cried out to the Lord, and the Lord showed him a tree. When he cast it into the waters, the waters were made sweet.
There He made a statute and an ordinance for them, and there He tested them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “If you diligently heed the voice of the Lord your God and do what is right in His sight, give ear to His commandments and keep all His statutes, I will put none of the diseases on you which I have brought on the Egyptians. For I am the Lord who heals you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve wells of water and seventy palm trees; so they camped there by the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journeyed from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the Wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they departed from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole congregation of the children of Israel complained against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel said to them, “Oh, that we had died by the hand of the Lord in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the pots of meat and when we ate bread to the full! For you have brought us out into this wilderness to kill this whole assembly with hunger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you. And the people shall go out and gather a certain quota every day, that I may test them, whether they will walk in My law or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be on the sixth day that they shall prepare what they bring in, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, “At evening you shall know that the Lord has brought you out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning you shall see the glory of the Lord; for He hears your complaints against the Lord. But what are we, that you complain against us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Moses said, “This shall be seen when the Lord gives you meat to eat in the evening, and in the morning bread to the full; for the Lord hears your complaints which you make against Him. And what are we? Your complaints are not against us but against the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spoke to Aaron, “Say to all the congregation of the children of Israel, ‘Come near before the Lord, for He has heard your complaints.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass, as Aaron spoke to the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and behold, the glory of the Lord appeared in the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard the complaints of the children of Israel. Speak to them, saying, ‘At twilight you shall eat meat, and in the morning you shall be filled with bread. And you shall know that I am the Lord your God.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it was that quail came up at evening and covered the camp, and in the morning the dew lay all around the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the layer of dew lifted, there, on the surface of the wilderness, was a small round substance, as fine as frost on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So when the children of Israel saw it, they said to one another, “What is it?” For they did not know what it was.
And Moses said to them, “This is the bread which the Lord has given you to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the thing which the Lord has commanded: ‘Let every man gather it according to each one’s need, one omer for each person, according to the number of persons; let every man take for those who are in his tent.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Israel did so and gathered, some more, some less.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they measured it by omers, he who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack. Every man had gathered according to each one’s need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “Let no one leave any of it till morning.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding they did not heed Moses. But some of them left part of it until morning, and it bred worms and stank. And Moses was angry with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gathered it every morning, every man according to his need. And when the sun became hot, it melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, on the sixth day, that they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one. And all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “This is what the Lord has said: ‘Tomorrow is a Sabbath rest, a holy Sabbath to the Lord. Bake what you will bake today, and boil what you will boil; and lay up for yourselves all that remains, to be kept until morning.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they laid it up till morning, as Moses commanded; and it did not stink, nor were there any worms in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “Eat that today, for today is a Sabbath to the Lord; today you will not find it in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall gather it, but on the seventh day, the Sabbath, there will be none.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, but they found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “How long do you refuse to keep My commandments and My laws?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See! For the Lord has given you the Sabbath; therefore He gives you on the sixth day bread for two days. Let every man remain in his place; let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people rested on the seventh day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
