verses.text: And the house of Israel called its name Manna. And it was like white coriander seed, and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “This is the thing which the Lord has commanded: ‘Fill an omer with it, to be kept for your generations, that they may see the bread with which I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Aaron, “Take a pot and put an omer of manna in it, and lay it up before the Lord, to be kept for your generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the children of Israel ate manna forty years, until they came to an inhabited land; they ate manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an omer is one-tenth of an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation of the children of Israel set out on their journey from the Wilderness of Sin, according to the commandment of the Lord, and camped in Rephidim; but there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the people contended with Moses, and said, “Give us water, that we may drink.”
So Moses said to them, “Why do you contend with me? Why do you tempt the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people thirsted there for water, and the people complained against Moses, and said, “Why is it you have brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our livestock with thirst?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “What shall I do with this people? They are almost ready to stone me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Go on before the people, and take with you some of the elders of Israel. Also take in your hand your rod with which you struck the river, and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock in Horeb; and you shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, that the people may drink.”
And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, because of the contention of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the Lord, saying, “Is the Lord among us or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Amalek came and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to Joshua, “Choose us some men and go out, fight with Amalek. Tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua did as Moses said to him, and fought with Amalek. And Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses’ hands became heavy; so they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it. And Aaron and Hur supported his hands, one on one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua defeated Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write this for a memorial in the book and recount it in the hearing of Joshua, that I will utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses built an altar and called its name, The-Lord-Is-My-Banner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he said, “Because the Lord has sworn: the Lord will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses and for Israel His people—that the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her back,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with her two sons, of whom the name of one was Gershom (for he said, “I have been a stranger in a foreign land”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the name of the other was Eliezer (for he said, “The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh”);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses in the wilderness, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he had said to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and her two sons with her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, bowed down, and kissed him. And they asked each other about their well-being, and they went into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardship that had come upon them on the way, and how the Lord had delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro rejoiced for all the good which the Lord had done for Israel, whom He had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jethro said, “Blessed be the Lord, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians and out of the hand of Pharaoh, and who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I know that the Lord is greater than all the gods; for in the very thing in which they behaved proudly, He was above them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt offering and other sacrifices to offer to God. And Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so it was, on the next day, that Moses sat to judge the people; and the people stood before Moses from morning until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing for the people? Why do you alone sit, and all the people stand before you from morning until evening?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have a difficulty, they come to me, and I judge between one and another; and I make known the statutes of God and His laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing that you do is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both you and these people who are with you will surely wear yourselves out. For this thing is too much for you; you are not able to perform it by yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen now to my voice; I will give you counsel, and God will be with you: Stand before God for the people, so that you may bring the difficulties to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall teach them the statutes and the laws, and show them the way in which they must walk and the work they must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover you shall select from all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them judge the people at all times. Then it will be that every great matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they themselves shall judge. So it will be easier for you, for they will bear the burden with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do this thing, and God so commands you, then you will be able to endure, and all this people will also go to their place in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses heeded the voice of his father-in-law and did all that he had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people: rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they judged the people at all times; the hard cases they brought to Moses, but they judged every small case themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went his way to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third month after the children of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on the same day, they came to the Wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they had departed from Rephidim, had come to the Wilderness of Sinai, and camped in the wilderness. So Israel camped there before the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses went up to God, and the Lord called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus you shall say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey My voice and keep My covenant, then you shall be a special treasure to Me above all people; for all the earth is Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words which you shall speak to the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before them all these words which the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people answered together and said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do.” So Moses brought back the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Lord said to Moses, “Behold, I come to you in the thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with you, and believe you forever.”
So Moses told the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them be ready for the third day. For on the third day the Lord will come down upon Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set bounds for the people all around, saying, ‘Take heed to yourselves that you do not go up to the mountain or touch its base. Whoever touches the mountain shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not a hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot with an arrow; whether man or beast, he shall not live.’ When the trumpet sounds long, they shall come near the mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and sanctified the people, and they washed their clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the people, “Be ready for the third day; do not come near your wives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it came to pass on the third day, in the morning, that there were thunderings and lightnings, and a thick cloud on the mountain; and the sound of the trumpet was very loud, so that all the people who were in the camp trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mount Sinai was completely in smoke, because the Lord descended upon it in fire. Its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the blast of the trumpet sounded long and became louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him by voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord came down upon Mount Sinai, on the top of the mountain. And the Lord called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Go down and warn the people, lest they break through to gaze at the Lord, and many of them perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also let the priests who come near the Lord consecrate themselves, lest the Lord break out against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses said to the Lord, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai; for You warned us, saying, ‘Set bounds around the mountain and consecrate it.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “Away! Get down and then come up, you and Aaron with you. But do not let the priests and the people break through to come up to the Lord, lest He break out against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God spoke all these words, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall have no other gods before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not make for yourself a carved image—any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not bow down to them nor serve them. For I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing mercy to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord your God. In it you shall do no work: you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your cattle, nor your stranger who is within your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in six days the Lord made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and hallowed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long upon the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the people witnessed the thunderings, the lightning flashes, the sound of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they trembled and stood afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Moses, “You speak with us, and we will hear; but let not God speak with us, lest we die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to the people, “Do not fear; for God has come to test you, and that His fear may be before you, so that you may not sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people stood afar off, but Moses drew near the thick darkness where God was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: ‘You have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make anything to be with Me—gods of silver or gods of gold you shall not make for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An altar of earth you shall make for Me, and you shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I record My name I will come to you, and I will bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you make Me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stone; for if you use your tool on it, you have profaned it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor shall you go up by steps to My altar, that your nakedness may not be exposed on it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now these are the judgments which you shall set before them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you buy a Hebrew servant, he shall serve six years; and in the seventh he shall go out free and pay nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes in by himself, he shall go out by himself; if he comes in married, then his wife shall go out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his master has given him a wife, and she has borne him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall be her master’s, and he shall go out by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the servant plainly says, ‘I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not go out free,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his master shall bring him to the judges. He shall also bring him to the door, or to the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall serve him forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if a man sells his daughter to be a female slave, she shall not go out as the male slaves do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she does not please her master, who has betrothed her to himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no right to sell her to a foreign people, since he has dealt deceitfully with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he has betrothed her to his son, he shall deal with her according to the custom of daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he takes another wife, he shall not diminish her food, her clothing, and her marriage rights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he does not do these three for her, then she shall go out free, without paying money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who strikes a man so that he dies shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if he did not lie in wait, but God delivered him into his hand, then I will appoint for you a place where he may flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if a man acts with premeditation against his neighbor, to kill him by treachery, you shall take him from My altar, that he may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And he who strikes his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who kidnaps a man and sells him, or if he is found in his hand, shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And he who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If men contend with each other, and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist, and he does not die but is confined to his bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he rises again and walks about outside with his staff, then he who struck him shall be acquitted. He shall only pay for the loss of his time, and shall provide for him to be thoroughly healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if a man beats his male or female servant with a rod, so that he dies under his hand, he shall surely be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, if he remains alive a day or two, he shall not be punished; for he is his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If men fight, and hurt a woman with child, so that she gives birth prematurely, yet no harm follows, he shall surely be punished accordingly as the woman’s husband imposes on him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any harm follows, then you shall give life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burn for burn, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man strikes the eye of his male or female servant, and destroys it, he shall let him go free for the sake of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he knocks out the tooth of his male or female servant, he shall let him go free for the sake of his tooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If an ox gores a man or a woman to death, then the ox shall surely be stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be acquitted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the ox tended to thrust with its horn in times past, and it has been made known to his owner, and he has not kept it confined, so that it has killed a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned and its owner also shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is imposed on him a sum of money, then he shall pay to redeem his life, whatever is imposed on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it has gored a son or gored a daughter, according to this judgment it shall be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the ox gores a male or female servant, he shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if a man opens a pit, or if a man digs a pit and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit shall make it good; he shall give money to their owner, but the dead animal shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one man’s ox hurts another’s, so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and divide the money from it; and the dead ox they shall also divide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if it was known that the ox tended to thrust in time past, and its owner has not kept it confined, he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead animal shall be his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and slaughters it or sells it, he shall restore five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief is found breaking in, and he is struck so that he dies, there shall be no guilt for his bloodshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the sun has risen on him, there shall be guilt for his bloodshed. He should make full restitution; if he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the theft is certainly found alive in his hand, whether it is an ox or donkey or sheep, he shall restore double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man causes a field or vineyard to be grazed, and lets loose his animal, and it feeds in another man’s field, he shall make restitution from the best of his own field and the best of his own vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If fire breaks out and catches in thorns, so that stacked grain, standing grain, or the field is consumed, he who kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man delivers to his neighbor money or articles to keep, and it is stolen out of the man’s house, if the thief is found, he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief is not found, then the master of the house shall be brought to the judges to see whether he has put his hand into his neighbor’s goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For any kind of trespass, whether it concerns an ox, a donkey, a sheep, or clothing, or for any kind of lost thing which another claims to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and whomever the judges condemn shall pay double to his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man delivers to his neighbor a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any animal to keep, and it dies, is hurt, or driven away, no one seeing it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then an oath of the Lord shall be between them both, that he has not put his hand into his neighbor’s goods; and the owner of it shall accept that, and he shall not make it good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if, in fact, it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is torn to pieces by a beast, then he shall bring it as evidence, and he shall not make good what was torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if a man borrows anything from his neighbor, and it becomes injured or dies, the owner of it not being with it, he shall surely make it good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If its owner was with it, he shall not make it good; if it was hired, it came for its hire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man entices a virgin who is not betrothed, and lies with her, he shall surely pay the bride-price for her to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money according to the bride-price of virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not permit a sorceress to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who sacrifices to any god, except to the Lord only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall neither mistreat a stranger nor oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not afflict any widow or fatherless child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you afflict them in any way, and they cry at all to Me, I will surely hear their cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and My wrath will become hot, and I will kill you with the sword; your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you lend money to any of My people who are poor among you, you shall not be like a moneylender to him; you shall not charge him interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ever take your neighbor’s garment as a pledge, you shall return it to him before the sun goes down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For that is his only covering, it is his garment for his skin. What will he sleep in? And it will be that when he cries to Me, I will hear, for I am gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not revile God, nor curse a ruler of your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not delay to offer the first of your ripe produce and your juices. The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise you shall do with your oxen and your sheep. It shall be with its mother seven days; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall be holy men to Me: you shall not eat meat torn by beasts in the field; you shall throw it to the dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not circulate a false report. Do not put your hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not follow a crowd to do evil; nor shall you testify in a dispute so as to turn aside after many to pervert justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not show partiality to a poor man in his dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you meet your enemy’s ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely bring it back to him again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see the donkey of one who hates you lying under its burden, and you would refrain from helping it, you shall surely help him with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not pervert the judgment of your poor in his dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep yourself far from a false matter; do not kill the innocent and righteous. For I will not justify the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds the discerning and perverts the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also you shall not oppress a stranger, for you know the heart of a stranger, because you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Six years you shall sow your land and gather in its produce,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what they leave, the beasts of the field may eat. In like manner you shall do with your vineyard and your olive grove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female servant and the stranger may be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And in all that I have said to you, be circumspect and make no mention of the name of other gods, nor let it be heard from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Three times you shall keep a feast to Me in the year:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread (you shall eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month of Abib, for in it you came out of Egypt; none shall appear before Me empty);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Feast of Harvest, the firstfruits of your labors which you have sown in the field; and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you have gathered in the fruit of your labors from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread; nor shall the fat of My sacrifice remain until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first of the firstfruits of your land you shall bring into the house of the Lord your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I send an Angel before you to keep you in the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware of Him and obey His voice; do not provoke Him, for He will not pardon your transgressions; for My name is in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you indeed obey His voice and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My Angel will go before you and bring you in to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzites and the Canaanites and the Hivites and the Jebusites; and I will cut them off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do according to their works; but you shall utterly overthrow them and completely break down their sacred pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you shall serve the Lord your God, and He will bless your bread and your water. And I will take sickness away from the midst of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall suffer miscarriage or be barren in your land; I will fulfill the number of your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will send My fear before you, I will cause confusion among all the people to whom you come, and will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send hornets before you, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate and the beasts of the field become too numerous for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased, and you inherit the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will set your bounds from the Red Sea to the sea, Philistia, and from the desert to the River. For I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against Me. For if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now He said to Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel, and worship from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses alone shall come near the Lord, but they shall not come near; nor shall the people go up with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord and all the judgments. And all the people answered with one voice and said, “All the words which the Lord has said we will do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses wrote all the words of the Lord. And he rose early in the morning, and built an altar at the foot of the mountain, and twelve pillars according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took half the blood and put it in basins, and half the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read in the hearing of the people. And they said, “All that the Lord has said we will do, and be obedient.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses took the blood, sprinkled it on the people, and said, “This is the blood of the covenant which the Lord has made with you according to all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up, also Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they saw the God of Israel. And there was under His feet as it were a paved work of sapphire stone, and it was like the very heavens in its clarity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the nobles of the children of Israel He did not lay His hand. So they saw God, and they ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and be there; and I will give you tablets of stone, and the law and commandments which I have written, that you may teach them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses arose with his assistant Joshua, and Moses went up to the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we come back to you. Indeed, Aaron and Hur are with you. If any man has a difficulty, let him go to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up into the mountain, and a cloud covered the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the glory of the Lord rested on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. And on the seventh day He called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sight of the glory of the Lord was like a consuming fire on the top of the mountain in the eyes of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went into the midst of the cloud and went up into the mountain. And Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, that they bring Me an offering. From everyone who gives it willingly with his heart you shall take My offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the offering which you shall take from them: gold, silver, and bronze;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple, and scarlet thread, fine linen, and goats’ hair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ram skins dyed red, badger skins, and acacia wood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for the light, and spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod and in the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let them make Me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that I show you, that is, the pattern of the tabernacle and the pattern of all its furnishings, just so you shall make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And they shall make an ark of acacia wood; two and a half cubits shall be its length, a cubit and a half its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and out you shall overlay it, and shall make on it a molding of gold all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in its four corners; two rings shall be on one side, and two rings on the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, that the ark may be carried by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles shall be in the rings of the ark; they shall not be taken from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put into the ark the Testimony which I will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold; two and a half cubits shall be its length and a cubit and a half its width.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make two cherubim of gold; of hammered work you shall make them at the two ends of the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make one cherub at one end, and the other cherub at the other end; you shall make the cherubim at the two ends of it of one piece with the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cherubim shall stretch out their wings above, covering the mercy seat with their wings, and they shall face one another; the faces of the cherubim shall be toward the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat on top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the Testimony that I will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there I will meet with you, and I will speak with you from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim which are on the ark of the Testimony, about everything which I will give you in commandment to the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a table of acacia wood; two cubits shall be its length, a cubit its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall overlay it with pure gold, and make a molding of gold all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for it a frame of a handbreadth all around, and you shall make a gold molding for the frame all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings on the four corners that are at its four legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings shall be close to the frame, as holders for the poles to bear the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be carried with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its dishes, its pans, its pitchers, and its bowls for pouring. You shall make them of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall set the showbread on the table before Me always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a lampstand of pure gold; the lampstand shall be of hammered work. Its shaft, its branches, its bowls, its ornamental knobs, and flowers shall be of one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And six branches shall come out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three bowls shall be made like almond blossoms on one branch, with an ornamental knob and a flower, and three bowls made like almond blossoms on the other branch, with an ornamental knob and a flower—and so for the six branches that come out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the lampstand itself four bowls shall be made like almond blossoms, each with its ornamental knob and flower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there shall be a knob under the first two branches of the same, a knob under the second two branches of the same, and a knob under the third two branches of the same, according to the six branches that extend from the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their knobs and their branches shall be of one piece; all of it shall be one hammered piece of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make seven lamps for it, and they shall arrange its lamps so that they give light in front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And its wick-trimmers and their trays shall be of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be made of a talent of pure gold, with all these utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And see to it that you make them according to the pattern which was shown you on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine woven linen and blue, purple, and scarlet thread; with artistic designs of cherubim you shall weave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits. And every one of the curtains shall have the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five curtains shall be coupled to one another, and the other five curtains shall be coupled to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make loops of blue yarn on the edge of the curtain on the selvedge of one set, and likewise you shall do on the outer edge of the other curtain of the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fifty loops you shall make in the one curtain, and fifty loops you shall make on the edge of the curtain that is on the end of the second set, that the loops may be clasped to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains together with the clasps, so that it may be one tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make curtains of goats’ hair, to be a tent over the tabernacle. You shall make eleven curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; and the eleven curtains shall all have the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall couple five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves, and you shall double over the sixth curtain at the forefront of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in one set, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain of the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make fifty bronze clasps, put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remnant that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a cubit on one side and a cubit on the other side, of what remains of the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle, on this side and on that side, to cover it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a covering of ram skins dyed red for the tent, and a covering of badger skins above that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And for the tabernacle you shall make the boards of acacia wood, standing upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half shall be the width of each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two tenons shall be in each board for binding one to another. Thus you shall make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under each of the boards for its two tenons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, there shall be twenty boards
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under each of the boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the far side of the tabernacle, westward, you shall make six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall also make two boards for the two back corners of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be coupled together at the bottom and they shall be coupled together at the top by one ring. Thus it shall be for both of them. They shall be for the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there shall be eight boards with their sockets of silver—sixteen sockets—two sockets under each of the boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the boards on one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five bars for the boards on the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the far side westward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The middle bar shall pass through the midst of the boards from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay the boards with gold, make their rings of gold as holders for the bars, and overlay the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall raise up the tabernacle according to its pattern which you were shown on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a veil woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen. It shall be woven with an artistic design of cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall hang it upon the four pillars of acacia wood overlaid with gold. Their hooks shall be gold, upon four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall hang the veil from the clasps. Then you shall bring the ark of the Testimony in there, behind the veil. The veil shall be a divider for you between the holy place and the Most Holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat upon the ark of the Testimony in the Most Holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand across from the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south; and you shall put the table on the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a screen for the door of the tabernacle, woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, made by a weaver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold; their hooks shall be gold, and you shall cast five sockets of bronze for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make an altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar shall be square—and its height shall be three cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you shall make its pans to receive its ashes, and its shovels and its basins and its forks and its firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a grate for it, a network of bronze; and on the network you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put it under the rim of the altar beneath, that the network may be midway up the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles shall be put in the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar to bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make it hollow with boards; as it was shown you on the mountain, so shall they make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make the court of the tabernacle. For the south side there shall be hangings for the court made of fine woven linen, one hundred cubits long for one side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets shall be bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise along the length of the north side there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, with its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And along the width of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the court on the east side shall be fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings on one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the gate of the court there shall be a screen twenty cubits long, woven of blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, made by a weaver. It shall have four pillars and four sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars around the court shall have bands of silver; their hooks shall be of silver and their sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits, the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits, made of fine woven linen, and its sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the utensils of the tabernacle for all its service, all its pegs, and all the pegs of the court, shall be of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall command the children of Israel that they bring you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to cause the lamp to burn continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tabernacle of meeting, outside the veil which is before the Testimony, Aaron and his sons shall tend it from evening until morning before the Lord. It shall be a statute forever to their generations on behalf of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now take Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister to Me as priest, Aaron and Aaron’s sons: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall speak to all who are gifted artisans, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron’s garments, to consecrate him, that he may minister to Me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, an ephod, a robe, a skillfully woven tunic, a turban, and a sash. So they shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons, that he may minister to Me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall take the gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and the fine linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall make the ephod of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, artistically worked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall have two shoulder straps joined at its two edges, and so it shall be joined together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the intricately woven band of the ephod, which is on it, shall be of the same workmanship, made of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on one stone and six names on the other stone, in order of their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, you shall engrave the two stones with the names of the sons of Israel. You shall set them in settings of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put the two stones on the shoulders of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel. So Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord on his two shoulders as a memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also make settings of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall make two chains of pure gold like braided cords, and fasten the braided chains to the settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the breastplate of judgment. Artistically woven according to the workmanship of the ephod you shall make it: of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet thread, and fine woven linen, you shall make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be doubled into a square: a span shall be its length, and a span shall be its width.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put settings of stones in it, four rows of stones: The first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and an emerald; this shall be the first row;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the second row shall be a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be set in gold settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the stones shall have the names of the sons of Israel, twelve according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, each one with its own name; they shall be according to the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make chains for the breastplate at the end, like braided cords of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make two rings of gold for the breastplate, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the breastplate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the other two ends of the two braided chains you shall fasten to the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod in the front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on the edge of it, which is on the inner side of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And two other rings of gold you shall make, and put them on the two shoulder straps, underneath the ephod toward its front, right at the seam above the intricately woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall bind the breastplate by means of its rings to the rings of the ephod, using a blue cord, so that it is above the intricately woven band of the ephod, and so that the breastplate does not come loose from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel on the breastplate of judgment over his heart, when he goes into the holy place, as a memorial before the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be over Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the Lord. So Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel over his heart before the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be an opening for his head in the middle of it; it shall have a woven binding all around its opening, like the opening in a coat of mail, so that it does not tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet, all around its hem, and bells of gold between them all around:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be upon Aaron when he ministers, and its sound will be heard when he goes into the holy place before the Lord and when he comes out, that he may not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall also make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving of a signet:
HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put it on a blue cord, that it may be on the turban; it shall be on the front of the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it shall be on Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things which the children of Israel hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall always be on his forehead, that they may be accepted before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall skillfully weave the tunic of fine linen thread, you shall make the turban of fine linen, and you shall make the sash of woven work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For Aaron’s sons you shall make tunics, and you shall make sashes for them. And you shall make hats for them, for glory and beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you shall put them on Aaron your brother and on his sons with him. You shall anoint them, consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to Me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make for them linen trousers to cover their nakedness; they shall reach from the waist to the thighs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they come into the tabernacle of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister in the holy place, that they do not incur iniquity and die. It shall be a statute forever to him and his descendants after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And this is what you shall do to them to hallow them for ministering to Me as priests: Take one young bull and two rams without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil (you shall make them of wheat flour).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them in one basket and bring them in the basket, with the bull and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And Aaron and his sons you shall bring to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and you shall wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take the garments, put the tunic on Aaron, and the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the intricately woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the turban on his head, and put the holy crown on the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take the anointing oil, pour it on his head, and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring his sons and put tunics on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall gird them with sashes, Aaron and his sons, and put the hats on them. The priesthood shall be theirs for a perpetual statute. So you shall consecrate Aaron and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also have the bull brought before the tabernacle of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall kill the bull before the Lord, by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take some of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and pour all the blood beside the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take all the fat that covers the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the flesh of the bull, with its skin and its offal, you shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall kill the ram, and you shall take its blood and sprinkle it all around on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall cut the ram in pieces, wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and with its head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord; it is a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall kill the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, on the thumb of their right hand and on the big toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood all around on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar, and some of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments, on his sons and on the garments of his sons with him; and he and his garments shall be hallowed, and his sons and his sons’ garments with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also you shall take the fat of the ram, the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, the two kidneys and the fat on them, the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one loaf of bread, one cake made with oil, and one wafer from the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall put all these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and you shall wave them as a wave offering before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall receive them back from their hands and burn them on the altar as a burnt offering, as a sweet aroma before the Lord. It is an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s consecration and wave it as a wave offering before the Lord; and it shall be your portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the ram of the consecration you shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering which is waved, and the thigh of the heave offering which is raised, of that which is for Aaron and of that which is for his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be from the children of Israel for Aaron and his sons by a statute forever. For it is a heave offering; it shall be a heave offering from the children of Israel from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, that is, their heave offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed in them and to be consecrated in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That son who becomes priest in his place shall put them on for seven days, when he enters the tabernacle of meeting to minister in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall take the ram of the consecration and boil its flesh in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall eat those things with which the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them; but an outsider shall not eat them, because they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any of the flesh of the consecration offerings, or of the bread, remains until the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire. It shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall do to Aaron and his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. Seven days you shall consecrate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall offer a bull every day as a sin offering for atonement. You shall cleanse the altar when you make atonement for it, and you shall anoint it to sanctify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and sanctify it. And the altar shall be most holy. Whatever touches the altar must be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two lambs of the first year, day by day continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the one lamb shall be one-tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of pressed oil, and one-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other lamb you shall offer at twilight; and you shall offer with it the grain offering and the drink offering, as in the morning, for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet you to speak with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle shall be sanctified by My glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will consecrate the tabernacle of meeting and the altar. I will also consecrate both Aaron and his sons to minister to Me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will dwell among the children of Israel and will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them. I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make an altar to burn incense on; you shall make it of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A cubit shall be its length and a cubit its width—it shall be square—and two cubits shall be its height. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall overlay its top, its sides all around, and its horns with pure gold; and you shall make for it a molding of gold all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two gold rings you shall make for it, under the molding on both its sides. You shall place them on its two sides, and they will be holders for the poles with which to bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put it before the veil that is before the ark of the Testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the Testimony, where I will meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron shall burn on it sweet incense every morning; when he tends the lamps, he shall burn incense on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Aaron lights the lamps at twilight, he shall burn incense on it, a perpetual incense before the Lord throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not offer strange incense on it, or a burnt offering, or a grain offering; nor shall you pour a drink offering on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall make atonement upon its horns once a year with the blood of the sin offering of atonement; once a year he shall make atonement upon it throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you take the census of the children of Israel for their number, then every man shall give a ransom for himself to the Lord, when you number them, that there may be no plague among them when you number them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what everyone among those who are numbered shall give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (a shekel is twenty gerahs). The half-shekel shall be an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone included among those who are numbered, from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich shall not give more and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when you give an offering to the Lord, to make atonement for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take the atonement money of the children of Israel, and shall appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of meeting, that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before the Lord, to make atonement for yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a laver of bronze, with its base also of bronze, for washing. You shall put it between the tabernacle of meeting and the altar. And you shall put water in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in water from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they go into the tabernacle of meeting, or when they come near the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to the Lord, they shall wash with water, lest they die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, lest they die. And it shall be a statute forever to them—to him and his descendants throughout their generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also take for yourself quality spices—five hundred shekels of liquid myrrh, half as much sweet-smelling cinnamon (two hundred and fifty shekels), two hundred and fifty shekels of sweet-smelling cane,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five hundred shekels of cassia, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and a hin of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make from these a holy anointing oil, an ointment compounded according to the art of the perfumer. It shall be a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With it you shall anoint the tabernacle of meeting and the ark of the Testimony;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the laver and its base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall consecrate them, that they may be most holy; whatever touches them must be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may minister to Me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘This shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall not be poured on man’s flesh; nor shall you make any other like it, according to its composition. It is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it on an outsider, shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses: “Take sweet spices, stacte and onycha and galbanum, and pure frankincense with these sweet spices; there shall be equal amounts of each.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make of these an incense, a compound according to the art of the perfumer, salted, pure, and holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall beat some of it very fine, and put some of it before the Testimony in the tabernacle of meeting where I will meet with you. It shall be most holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the incense which you shall make, you shall not make any for yourselves, according to its composition. It shall be to you holy for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever makes any like it, to smell it, he shall be cut off from his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to design artistic works, to work in gold, in silver, in bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in cutting jewels for setting, in carving wood, and to work in all manner of workmanship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I, indeed I, have appointed with him Aholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and I have put wisdom in the hearts of all the gifted artisans, that they may make all that I have commanded you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tabernacle of meeting, the ark of the Testimony and the mercy seat that is on it, and all the furniture of the tabernacle—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table and its utensils, the pure gold lampstand with all its utensils, the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the laver and its base—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the garments of ministry, the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments of his sons, to minister as priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the anointing oil and sweet incense for the holy place. According to all that I have commanded you they shall do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak also to the children of Israel, saying: ‘Surely My Sabbaths you shall keep, for it is a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, that you may know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep the Sabbath, therefore, for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Work shall be done for six days, but the seventh is the Sabbath of rest, holy to the Lord. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day, he shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their generations as a perpetual covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sign between Me and the children of Israel forever; for in six days the Lord made the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day He rested and was refreshed.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had made an end of speaking with him on Mount Sinai, He gave Moses two tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the people saw that Moses delayed coming down from the mountain, the people gathered together to Aaron, and said to him, “Come, make us gods that shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron said to them, “Break off the golden earrings which are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people broke off the golden earrings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he received the gold from their hand, and he fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made a molded calf.
Then they said, “This is your god, O Israel, that brought you out of the land of Egypt!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Aaron saw it, he built an altar before it. And Aaron made a proclamation and said, “Tomorrow is a feast to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they rose early on the next day, offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses, “Go, get down! For your people whom you brought out of the land of Egypt have corrupted themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
